summary:
Provides advice on ways to succeed in business, finance, careers,
dating, marriage, school, and getting along with others.

Problems arise when identical twins Emma and Sam switch places in
order to solve each other's problems, and the girls worry that
things will only get worse if the truth about their plan is revealed.

As explained by the kids themselves, this book offers a collection of
true stories that deal with moments of embarrassment and awkwardness
while providing tips and advice on how to handle such difficult
situations when they arise.

As the waters of the Mississippi River rise with each and every
moment, Molly and Garrett risk their lives to save their collection of
nickles and pennies as it is their only hope of getting out of their
poverty-stricken world. Original.

The unforgettable novel of a childhood in a sleepy Southern town and
the crisis of conscience that rocked it, To Kill A Mockingbird became
both an instant bestseller and a critical success when it was first
published in 1960.

True story of how three men and a great racehorse captivated the
world.

Presents an anthology of Christmas stories reflecting on the various
ways in which the holidays serve as a catalyst to promote change,
growth, and new beginnings

A forensic pathologist returns to Sri Lanka--after 15 years abroad--to
assist in identifying victims of the country's civil war
Tyrel and Orrin Sackett travel from Tennessee to Santa Fe.

When conflicts between rivaling cultures aboard Babylon 5 escalate to
riotous proportions, security chief Garibaldi discovers a link between
a station-wide epidemic in nightmares and a strange alien presence.
Original.

In charming, beautiful, and wealthy old-South Savannah, Georgia, the
local bad boy is shot dead inside of the opulent mansion of a gay
antiques dealer, and a gripping trial follows

Written with the intelligence and grace that are the hallmarks of
Anita Shreve's bestselling novels, this gripping tale of desire,
jealousy, and loss is peopled by unforgettable characters as real as
the emotions that bring them together.

Restless loner and motorcycle rider Michael Tillman is unable to
resist his powerful feelings for Jellie Braden, a free spirit trapped
in a passionless marriage. By the author of The Bridges of Madison
County. Reprint.

Weaves together two stories in the account of how fifteen-year-old
Arthur Parkinson's family fell apart and the life and death of
Annie Marchand, a young woman Arthur adored as a child

Kate Morrison, orphaned at the age of seven, grows up seeing her
brilliant older brother Matt's failure to further his education as
a tragedy, and feeling somewhat guilty about her own accomplishments,
and it is not until years later that ...

The reminiscences of a New York lawyer, Jim Burden, about his boyhood
in Nebraska, particularly a young Bohemian girl named Antonia
Shimerda, are set against the backdrop of the American assimilation of
immigrants.

Racial tension, a forbidden love affair, and murder are seen through
the eyes of a seven-year-old boy in a 1950s Southern cotton-farming
community.

The life and times of aerospace engineer Home Hickman and his friends
in Big Creek, West Virginia.

This is the gently comic story of two insecure young people who share
a Brooklyn apartment: a gay man and a pregnant woman who are both on
the brink of financial and emotional disaster.

" -Kirkus Reviews "Clark has perfected the suspense novel,
where in classic Christie fashion, everyone is a potential
suspect...timely, and downright fun." -Booklist "A fast-
paced story line...a winner.

In a stark, troubling, yet ultimately triumphant celebration of self-
determination, award-winning author A. Manette Ansay re-creates a
stifling world of guilty and pain, and the tormented souls who inhabit
it.

Hoping to use a supposedly straightforward case of murder to clear his
mind, Deputy Chief Lucas Davenport finds himself matching wits with an
ever-escalating serial killer, art history professor, congenial
pervert, and sexual predator James ...

This gripping tale unfolds in a peaceful Minnesota town, where crime
is something that just doesn't happen. But when a young boy
disappears, it marks the beginning of a unspeakable nightmare.

Seriously injured in a car accident, Broadway actress Leigh Kendall
awakens to discover that her husband, Logan Manning, has disappeared,
and the police suspect her involvement, so she must unravel the nature
of his business to survive.

A superlative new collection of twenty-two stories by the author of
"The Martian Chronicles" includes the continuating saga of
H.G. Well's time traveller and his Toynbee Convector, a ghost on
the Orient Express, and a bored man who creates ...

The autobiography of a gay man's struggle with manhood focuses on
the author's attempts to live a normal life while concealing the
secret of his sexuality.

Copyright © Libri GmbH. All rights reserved. In this, his first novel,
V.S. Naipaul traces the meteoric rise and metamorphosis of Ganesh.

Gershon Loran, a quiet rabbinical student, is troubled by a dark
reality around him. Abandoned by his parents and friends, he sees hope
only in the study of the Kabbalah.

The story of Martiniano, the man who killed the deer, is a timeless
story of Pueblo Indian sin and redemption, and of the conflict between
Indian and white laws; written with a poetically charged beauty of
style, a purity of conception, and ...

In the strange house of Greyhaven, the young lovers, Anne and Kevin,
and the middle-aged romantics, Bea and Roger find themselves caught in
the beautiful but menacing world of pre-Christian sacrificial rites

Meg is haunted by a mysterious and increasingly dangerous chain of
events after inheriting her grandfather's antique store in New
England.

When Lucy Cartwright follows her dashing new husband, Baron Clare, to
his stunning estate, she learns that terror and betrayal lurk in its
corridors. By the author of Vanish with the Rose. Reprint.

In this whimsical giftbook, Harry M. Walker captures colorful images
of outhouses in every size, shape, and style.

Interweaves story and dream, past and present, and philosophy and
poetry in a sardonic and erotic tale of two couples--Tomas and Teresa,
and Sabina and her Swiss lover, Gerhart.

Theirs is a world filled with driving ambition, inescapable family
bonds, and forbidden love. Compellingly written, by turns menacingly
dark and hilariously funny, this is an epic tale of five generations
of sin, guilt, and redemption.

A detailed study of the ordinary life of Larry Weller between 1977 and
1997 follows the floral designer as he deals with the rapidly changing
world and two marriages and two divorces along the way. Reprint.

Kirk and McCoy accompany Spock to the Vulcan Academy Hospital, seeking
treatment for an Enterprise crew member. Kirk soon finds himself
involved in a homicide case.

Financial journalist Rebecca Bloomwood seeks solace from the boredom
and pressures in life with her shopping, a solution that brings her
close to financial disaster, until she encounters a story that will
change her life.

A Lesson Before Dying tells the story of these two men who, through no
choice of their own, come together and form a bond in the realization
that sometimes simply choosing to resist the expected is an act of
heroism.

Reissue. "Smart, funny and comforting . . . Lamott has a
conversational style that perfectly conveys her frie
"Belongs in the category ... of enduring American literature.

A mother fights for the dignity of her youngest daughter against the
backdrop of a pure and simple way of life in the backwoods of
Mississippi in 1943

Chronicles the harrowing journey of eleven women across the American
west and their efforts to settle in California.

Presents short stories of fantasy and horror which are set either in
the future or in unknown worlds.

" --The New York Times Book Review "[Coonts's] gripping,
first-person narration of aerial combat is the best I've ever
read. Once begun, this book cannot be laid aside.

Seeking refuge in the ancient, mouldering home of their ancestors on
an island off the coast of Scotland, Effie and her mother, Nora,
reveal the secrets of their lives and loves, past and present, to each
other, in a hilarious novel about ...

Stripped of her image and identity after a devastating car accident
and the resulting reconstructive surgery, Charlotte Swenson, a jaded
model, struggles to rebuild her life in a culture obsessed with
surface appearance.

One of the 20th Century's most beloved novels is still winning
hearts! I Capture the Castle tells the story of seventeen-year-old
Cassandra and her family, who live in not-so-genteel poverty in a
ramshackle old English castle.

In 1899 London, Dr. Andrew Quimby doesn't want to believe that
recent murders, in which the victims are drained of their blood, were
inhuman acts, but his lover harbors secrets that place them both in
danger as evil haunts the streets.

With AIDS about to claim a well-loved young man, three generations of
his family are reunited at his bedside in Ireland, in a novel that

family members.

T. S. Garp, a man with high ambitions for an artistic career and with
obsessive devotion to his wife and children, and Jenny Fields, his
famous feminist mother, find their lives surrounded by an assortment
of people including teachers, ...

Humiliated to discover that her ex-boyfriend has been chronicling
their former sex life in a series of articles called "Loving a
Larger Woman" in a popular women's magazine, pop-culture
journalist Cannie Shapiro embarks on an adventure ...

In this manifesto for the Information Revolution, "techno-
humanitarians"--engineers, programmers, computer scientists, and
activists--see a future in which computers help humankind strengthen
democratic values.

Wild animus is a search for the primordial, a test of human
foundations and a journey to the breaking point.

Surprising transformations take place when a newspaperman's
elderly aunt and two daughters decide to move back to their family
home on the coast of Newfoundland

After a fatal airline crash in the mountains of North Carolina, Dr.
Temperance Brennan heads to the site to help identify the victims, but
the discovery of body parts that do not belong to any registered
passenger leads the investigation ...

In 1954, Ishmael Chambers, a local reporter who lost an arm in the
war, covers the murder trial of a Japanese American fisherman, whose
wife had been Ishmael's childhood sweetheart

A couple traveling through the hill towns of Italy finds themselves
and learns something about marriage on their journey. By the author of
Colony. 200,000 first printing. $250,000 ad/promo. Tour.

A fresh retelling of the ancient texts about Ishtar, the world's
first goddess. Illustrated with visual artifacts of the period.
"A great masterpiece of universal literature."--Mircea
Eliade

In the icy jaws of an early winter, three big-city professionals
joined Phil Broker on a canoe trip across Minnesota's remotest
lake.

Includes a section on women pilots in the armed services, and a
project related to the story.

By turns funny, poignant and mystical, Keeper'n Me reflects a
positive view of Native life and philosophy--as well as casting fresh
light on the redemptive power of one's community and traditions.

Explains how viruses and bacteria can make people sick, shows how the
body keeps them out, and suggests ways to help your body avoid illness

Harvard symbologist Robert Langdon and French cryptologist Sophie
Neveu work to solve the murder of an elderly curator of the Louvre, a
case which leads to clues hidden in the works of Da Vinci and a
centuries-old secret society.

In A Secret Affair, she touches on subjects that will stir the hearts
and minds of her readers -- unconditional love and devotion, loyalty
and loss.
It is 1999.

One hundred percent of the author's profits from this book will be
donated to a charity that benefits seniors through The Charles Schwab
Corporation Foundation.

Grieving over the loss of her fiance, Chief of Police Holly Barker
joins forces with a handsome FBI agent to investigate the murders of
two Miami businessmen, following clues that lead into the middle of a
lethal real-estate scam.

The author, a former guard at Sing Sing prison, looks back on his
rookie year in the prison as he attempts to balance basic human
decency with the rigors of the prison system. Reprint. 60,000 first
printing.

Ellie, a restauranteer and heir to a fortune, and ex-cop Dan Cassidy
form a friendship on the verge of love, but her half-brother Buck
Duveen has just been released from a sanitarium and is plotting to
reclaim the inheritance he was denied ...

Winnie Louie, an aging Chinese woman convinced that she will die soon,
decides to unburden herself by divulging the secrets of those closest

printing. $10,000 ad/promo.

The discovery of the decomposed body of a stowaway aboard a cargo ship

An attractive, sexually voracious woman from New York begins a
harrowing journey when she encounters a handsome man having sex in the
basement of a bar.

Katie, a liberal, urban mother and doctor from North London, finds her
life turned upside down when her husband, David, undergoes an
outrageous spiritual transformation, in a hilarious novel about
marriage, parenthood, religion, and ...

Frozen by the new science of cryonics in 1988, Benjamin Smith, as well
as the rest of his family, returns to life eighty-three years later in
a world changed by the availability of eternal youth and cloning.
Reprint. PW.

Headstrong heiress Sharisse Hammond wants no part of the New York
society marriage that has been arranged for her.

A moving and life-affirming tale of the goodness implicit in everyone

good things for each other.

Here is the Story that Introduced Readers to this Unforgettable Place
and the People Who Live There, in One of his Most Beloved Novels...
The life of a ten-year-old girl is shattered by two drunken and
remorseless young men.

In 1865, the preparations of the Dante Club--led by Henry Wadsworth
Longfellow and Oliver Wendell Holmes--to release the first translation
of Dante's "The Divine Comedy" are threatened by a
series of murders that re-create episodes from  ...

Young Sam Gribley spends a winter alone in the Catskills by living off
the land.
Printed on the top left of the envelope was the number one.

A family saga chronicles a century of life as four generations of
Yorkshire women move through two World Wars, coronations, secrets,

After her "stand-in mother," a bold black woman named
Rosaleen, insults the three biggest racists in town, Lily Owens joins

Retiree Carole Seddon's peaceful life in the English seaside town

This is the story of the Bigelow and Hilyard clans, from their first
years on America's shores, through the fury of her wars and the

brought together by a misdelivered package and urged into their own

Uncle Fred (Lord Ickenham) wants Pongo to marry Sally Painter, a not
very successful American sculptor in Chelsea. They had been engaged,

Blends elements of psychoanalysis and Asian religions to probe an

A suicidal billionaire, a burnt-out Washington litigator, and a woman

Kwani, an Anasazi Indian beauty, provokes the romantic interest of

"Reprinted by arrangement with Ticknor & Fields"--T.p.
verso.

A biography of the famous Shawnee describes Tecumseh's plan to
amalgamate all North American tribes into one people, his role as

When twelve-year-old Billy Straight, a runaway struggling to survive

a killer, as L.A.P.D. homicide ...
A NOVEL ABOUT THE COMPLEX BONDS BETWEEN A MOTHER AND A DAUGHTER.

Hilarious and informative, this collection of fly-fishing essays takes

Winner of the CWA John Creasey Award for Best First Novel of the Year
- and the start of Minette Walter's long list of bestsellers.It

At bedtime a small boy tries to control ten insatiable monsters
demanding food and creating chaos throughout the house.

In the first two books alone, the three youngsters encounter a greedy
and repulsive villain, itchy clothing, a disastrous fire, a plot to
steal their fortune, a lumpy bed, a deadly serpent, a large brass
reading lamp, a long knife, and a ...

During his third year at Hogwarts School for witchcraft and wizardry,

Recalls the events surrounding the Japanese surprise attack on Pearl

Early in his career, Jack Ryan accepts his first assignment as a
freelance analyst under James Greer of the CIA and faces a mission

A large-format treasury of cartoons featuring the mischievous six-

They were the gens de couleur libres-the Free People of Color-and in

This rustic retreat on a beautiful island is run by Hector and Virgil,

Given his lifetime assignment at the Ceremony of Twelve, Jonas becomes

Thirty-three years old, between relationships and apartments, and

CigarBox is as current as your newspaper. . . as timeless as your

A disfigured musical genius who lives beneath the Paris Opera House

Harry's destiny lies in the far mountains that she once wished to

Marine general Victor "Brute" Krulak offers here a riveting

Spread the word...but keep the secret! The Cube is an imagination game

When John Moore's big teddy bear is stolen from his shop porch and

Misunderstandings, the shadow of death, and a beautiful new life play

Providing frightening and funny real information in the best-selling

Adam and Eve examine the humorous relationship between men and women

An enthralling glimpse into the life of William Smith, a nineteenth-
century engineer who became the founding father of modern geology,

Covering marriage, children, grandparents, careers, retirement, and
more, this is the official book of The Red Hat Society, a craze that

A journey through religious thought collects the autobiographical
writings of sixty authors, and explores the nature of the inner life

In a new Introduction to The Wild Man's Journey, Father Richard
Rohr acknowledges the movement's contributions and analyzes its
weaknesses, tracing the journey of a man's life and offering seven

The less people possess of material things, the more they seem to

The author of The Artist's Way offers readers straightfoward
advice on how to unblock obstacles to creativity and the spiritual

Bringing to light the work of some of America's finest first- and

Living among scholars in the hallowed halls of Jordan College, Lyra

Father Terry Dunn thought he'd seen everything on the mean streets

Enid Lambert begins to worry about her husband when he begins to

With individuality discouraged by his employers, "United

When a teenage couple abandons their baby at the gate of the estate
owned by Lydia Blessing, Skip Cuddy, the estate caretaker, decides to

After scientists cloned Mewtwo from Mew, Mewtwo vows revenge and sets

Hidden Star by Nora Roberts released on Dec 25, 2000 is available now
for purchase.

Curtis Orville Mitchell, son of J.B. Mitchell and Emily McVey, was

Provides an account of the hurricane which struck Galveston, Texas, in

Mary is at last able to go to a college for the blind. Best of all,
Almanzo Wilder asks permission to walk home from church with Laura.
And Laura, now fifteen years old, receives her certificate to teach
school.

Romance fans will be swept away by Ms. Corgiat's dazzling

The author recounts his experiences traveling to Diego Garcia,

Interviews with sisters explore how they have changed each other's

Wanted! A gentleman of means, neither young nor decrepit.

Elegant and wise meditations on youth and age, love and marriage,

A mysterious transmission from the depths of the Atlantic Ocean sends

San Francisco Defense Attorney Dismas Hardy becomes personally

In mid-eighteenth-century Connecticut, members of one courageous and

A small-town girl fresh out of an Ivy League college lands a job at a

A pair of itinerant farm hands dream of someday having their own

Set in the time of King Louis XIV of France, this baroque, romantic

Two women were killed. 130 people were injured. Their names were added
to the growing list of victims of the troubles. The real victims were
the people left behind. This is their story.

With a timeless tale, appealing to all, this is a book that readers of
fine fiction, and those who loved Tuesdays with Morrie, will treasure.

In this collection of twenty-one unforgettable stories, Joyce Carol

Her seemingly idyllic life shadowed by a dark secret, sophisticated

Architect Lee Morris inherits partial ownership of the Stratton Park

PW.
The Magic Had Always Been There.

Working in Gaborone, Botswana, Precious Ramotswe investigates several

Irrepressible sleuth Precious Ramotswe searches for a young man who
vanished many years ago on the African plains, while dealing with her

Both novellas are set in Germany during World War II. Each

Laurel Hand is forced to face her Southern past when she returns to

While cycling through the western states, a disillusioned American
questions the meaning of existence after confronting the ghost of his

The ordinary interactions and everyday routines of the Watsons, an
African American family living in Flint, Michigan, are drastically

A proud family's deadly secrets are exposed in this passionate
tale of two rivals who, while toiling in the Napa Valley vineyards,

"Captivating, minutely imagined . . . a novel that refuses to

A forensic pathologist returns to Sri Lanka--after 15 years abroad--to

Examines the phenomenon of quitting as a healthy and common human

When a new "lector" arrives at a Cuban-American cigar

Short stories offer a satiric look at modern life, telling the stories

From the author of the classic multimillion-copy bestseller The Shell

When a vampire enlists the aid of cocktail waitress Sookie Stackhouse
to use her telepathic talents to find a missing vampire in Dallas, she

humans go unharmed. Original.

Astounding adventures, reckless courage, and fierce independence are

Several animals sleep snugly in Nicki's lost mitten until the bear

During the twenty-second century, a space probe's investigation of
